resources.string: A book or set of books giving information on many subjects or on many aspects of one subject and typically arranged alphabetically
Tiny life form seen only in a microscope
A damaging immune response by the body to a substance, especially a particular food, pollen, fur, or dust, to which it has become hypersensitive
A curved flat piece of wood that can be thrown so that it will return to the thrower, traditionally used by Australian Aborigines as a hunting weapon
The disguising of military personnel, equipment, and installations by painting or covering them to make them blend in with their surroundings
A container or detachable receptacle for holding a supply of cartridges to be fed automatically to the breech of a gun
A collection of historical documents or records providing information about a place, institution, or group of people
Any of the flat appendages growing from a bird\'s skin and forming its plumage, consisting of a partly hollow horny shaft fringed with vanes of barbs
The accomplishment of an aim or purpose
"Don't judge a book by its cover. "
"Let the buyer have a thousand eyes for the seller wants only one. "
"Better is one bird in the hand than two in the bush. "
"You've got to practice what you preach "
Are you sure you want to quit?
Are you sure you want to end current game?\nYour score will not be saved!
Sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety, often causing wildly unthinking behaviour
A person or thing that ruins something
Liked or admired by many people or by a particular person or group
The process of adapting something to modern needs or habits
Small pieces of coloured paper traditionally thrown over a person who is celebrating
A bulletin issued periodically to the members of a society or other organization
A person able or employed to do occasional domestic repairs and minor renovations
A small domed spongy cake made with eggs and baking powder
A dessert of thin pastry rolled up round a fruit filling and baked
The action or practice of relaxation and inner concentration
The action or process of collecting someone or something
A small instrument like a pair of pincers for plucking out hairs and picking up small objects
"An instrument used for cutting cloth, paper, and other material, consisting of two blades "
A plastic tube containing two chemicals which combine when the tube is bent, so producing a luminescent glow
A toy consisting of a tube containing mirrors and pieces of coloured glass or paper, whose reflections produce changing patterns when the tube is rotated
The ability to acquire and apply knowledge and skills
Relating to sound or the sense of hearing
A special right, advantage, or immunity granted or available only to a particular person or group
Prolonged public disagreement or heated discussion
Hopefulness and confidence about the future or the success of something
A group of opponents, especially in sport, business, or politics
The branch of applied mathematics dealing with motion and forces producing motion
A system of government in which most of the important decisions are taken by state officials rather than by elected representatives
A man trained to fight with weapons against other men or wild animals in an arena
The study of heredity and the variation of inherited characteristics
A dynamo or similar machine for converting mechanical energy into electricity
A small gregarious toothed whale that typically has a beaklike snout and a curved fin on the back, well known for their sociable nature and high intelligence
A large thick-skinned semiaquatic African mammal, with massive jaws and large tusks
A system of government by the whole population or all the eligible members of a state, typically through elected representatives
The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry
Love thy neighbor as you love thy self
Don\'t do unto others what you wouldn\'t want done to you
Who is wise? He who learns from all people
Who is rich? the one who is appreciates what he has
Life and death are in power of tongue
Hit the iron while it\'s hot
Can\'t see forest for the trees
He who laughs last, laughs best
Better to light a candle than to curse the darkness
Cheaters never win and winners never cheat
Don\'t cross the bridge till you come to it
Don\'t put the cart before the horse
"Fish always stink from the head down "
"Lightning never strikes twice in the same place "
One picture worth a thousand words
"Success has many fathers, while failure is an orphan "
"The apple never falls far from the tree "
"The best defence is a good offence "
"The darkest hour is just before the dawn "
"The longest journey starts with a single step "
"The road to hell is paved with good intentions "
"There are two sides to every coin "
"When in Rome, do as the Romans do "
"Where there's a will there's a way "
"You are never too old to learn "
He that tooteth his own horn, the same shall not be tooted
Take a selfie or choose a photo from gallery and enter your name

On each difficulty you must be much faster
Easy - 60 seconds per question
Medium - 30 seconds per question
Hard - 10 seconds per question
Check out the leader board or return to this tutorial

Spin the wheel and answer the questions as fast as you can
The faster you answer the more points you will get
Easy - 10-20 points
Medium - 20-50 points
Hard - 50-100 points
Discover the missing letter of the defined word

Surprise!
Double your score
Get extra life
Get 100 points
Loose 100 points
Loose all points
On completion of easy or medium difficulty you can try a harder challenge\nOn completion of hard difficulty try again to beat the high score
Visit the leader board and find your self among the all time players
